commit.message:
Remove support for using UWIN as a host machine.

	* configure.in: Issue an error message.
	* configure: Regenerated.
	* config.gcc: Remove xm_* UWIN configury.
	* config/i386/xm-uwin.h: Remove.

From-SVN: r38818

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,11 @@
+2001-01-09  Mark Mitchell  <mark@codesourcery.com>
+
+	Remove support for using UWIN as a host machine.
+	* configure.in: Issue an error message.
+	* configure: Regenerated.
+	* config.gcc: Remove xm_* UWIN configury.
+	* config/i386/xm-uwin.h: Remove.
+
 2001-01-08  Nick Clifton  <nickc@redhat.com>
 
 	* config/v850/v850.c (ra_rtx): Delete.

@@ -1465,8 +1465,6 @@ i[34567]86-*-mingw32*)
 	;;
 i[34567]86-*-uwin*)
 	tm_file=i386/uwin.h
-	xm_file="${xm_file} i386/xm-uwin.h"
-	xm_defines="USG NO_STAB_H"
 	tmake_file="i386/t-cygwin i386/t-uwin"
 	extra_objs=winnt.o
 	xmake_file=i386/x-cygwin

@@ -1,43 +0,0 @@
-/* Configuration for GNU C-compiler for hosting on Windows32.
-   using GNU tools and the Windows32 API Library.
-   Copyright (C) 1999 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
-   Contributed by Mumit Khan  <khan@xraylith.wisc.edu>.
-
-This file is part of GNU CC.
-
-GNU CC is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
-it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
-the Free Software Foundation; either version 2, or (at your option)
-any later version.
-
-GNU CC is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
-but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
-MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
-GNU General Public License for more details.
-
-You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
-along with GNU CC; see the file COPYING.  If not, write to
-the Free Software Foundation, 59 Temple Place - Suite 330,
-Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA. */
-
-#ifndef ONLY_INT_FIELD
-#define ONLY_INT_FIELDS 1
-#endif
-
-#ifndef USE_PROTOTYPES
-#define USE_PROTOTYPES 1
-#endif
-
-/* U/WIN system calls only support '/' */
-#undef DIR_SEPARATOR
-#define DIR_SEPARATOR '/'
-#undef EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX
-#define EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX ".exe"
-
-#undef PATH_SEPARATOR
-#define PATH_SEPARATOR ':'
-
-/* U/WIN 2.0b[3-5] bcopy was implemented using memcpy, which breaks the
-   C++ front end, so don't use it. */
-#undef HAVE_BCOPY
-

@@ -2944,19 +2944,18 @@ fi
 
 case "${host}" in
 *-*-uwin*)
-  # Under some versions of uwin, vfork is notoriously buggy and the test 
-  # can hang configure; on other versions, vfork exists just as a stub.
-  # FIXME: This should be removed once vfork in uwin's runtime is fixed.
-  ac_cv_func_vfork_works=no
+  { echo "configure: error: 
+*** UWIN may not be used as a host platform because
+*** linking with posix.dll is not allowed by the GNU GPL" 1>&2; exit 1; }
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2955: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2954: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2960 "configure"
+#line 2959 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2985,17 +2984,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2989: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2988: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2994 "configure"
+#line 2993 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2999: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2998: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -3020,18 +3019,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3024: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:3023: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3030: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:3029: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3035 "configure"
+#line 3034 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -3054,7 +3053,7 @@ vfork();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3058: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3057: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -3076,7 +3075,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3080 "configure"
+#line 3079 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -3171,7 +3170,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3175: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3174: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -3197,17 +3196,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3201: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:3200: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else

-#line 3206 "configure"

 EOF

-{ (eval echo configure:3211: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:3210: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -3236,12 +3235,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3240: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:3239: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3245 "configure"
+#line 3244 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -3264,7 +3263,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3268: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3267: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -3289,15 +3288,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap which provides zeroed pages anywhere""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3293: checking for working mmap which provides zeroed pages anywhere" >&5
+echo "configure:3292: checking for working mmap which provides zeroed pages anywhere" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3301 "configure"
+#line 3300 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Richard Henderson and Alexandre Oliva.
@@ -3380,7 +3379,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3384: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3383: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=yes
 else
@@ -3403,7 +3402,7 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap of a file""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3407: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5
+echo "configure:3406: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5

@@ -3418,7 +3417,7 @@ if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3422 "configure"
+#line 3421 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Zack Weinberg.  Modified from MMAP_ANYWHERE test by
@@ -3455,7 +3454,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3459: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3458: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=yes
 else
@@ -3488,12 +3487,12 @@ for ac_func in bcopy \
 do

-echo "configure:3492: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3491: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5

-#line 3497 "configure"

 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include "gansidecl.h"

 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3508: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3507: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -3597,12 +3596,12 @@ for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit getrusage
 do
   ac_tr_decl=HAVE_DECL_`echo $ac_func | tr 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3601: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3600: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 else

-#line 3606 "configure"

 #include "confdefs.h"

 #include "system.h"
@@ -3617,7 +3616,7 @@ char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func ;
 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3621: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3620: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else

 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3664: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:3663: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3669 "configure"
+#line 3668 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -3682,7 +3681,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3686: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3685: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -3993,15 +3992,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3997: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:3996: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4005 "configure"
+#line 4004 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -4012,7 +4011,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4016: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4015: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -4035,12 +4034,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4039: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:4038: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4044 "configure"

 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -4089,7 +4088,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4093: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4092: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else

 fi

-#line 4119 "configure"
+#line 4118 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -4143,12 +4142,12 @@ EOF
 fi

-echo "configure:4147: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:4146: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4152 "configure"
+#line 4151 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -4178,19 +4177,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4182: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:4181: checking for working alloca.h" >&5

 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }

-if { (eval echo configure:4194: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4193: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else

 fi

+if { (eval echo configure:4247: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*

 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6

+if { (eval echo configure:4337: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

-echo "configure:4365: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5

   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then

+#line 4372 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"

@@ -4388,7 +4387,7 @@ main ()

 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4392: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:4391: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
